results.title: A Winter's tale = Conte d'hiver
results.creator_credit: Margaret Menegoz, Eric Rohmer and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
Felicie’s love for Charles is undiminished four years after a romantic idyll during a summer holiday in Brittany but he has not contacted her - the home address she gave him was incorrect. In the meantime she has given birth to his daughter and is unable to choose between two adoring suitors. Rohmer, with more than a passing reference to Shakespeare, locates his customarily precise observation of the everyday complexities of human psychology in a tale of accident and coincidence. For Felice, the emotional aftermath of a lost summer is suspended or frozen until the thaw of a spring of promise. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Charlotte Very, Frederic Van Den Driessche and Michel Voletti.

results.title: A Window to trade
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and Susan Cornwell
results.brief_description: Shows the role of the International Trade Development Centres in advising and guiding business about the marketing of overseas products to Australia. Seminars are regularly conducted in all cities. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: A Window on the world of classical ballet
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Don Featherstone
results.brief_description: Narrated by Richard Morecroft, this entertaining and informative video takes a look at the dailt routine of the Australian Ballet to obtain a better understanding and appreciation of classical ballet. Watch a daily ballet class, take a peek behind the scenes of staging a ballet, meet the dancers and watch a rehearsal and performance of the Act II Pas de deux from Swan Lake. Featured artists include Miranda Coney, Greg Horsman, Steven Heathcote, Campbell McKenzie and Justine Summers and the Australian Ballet School.

results.title: A Wife among wives: notes on Turkana marriage
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Turkana Conversations No. 2”.
This film examines how an African tribe, the Turkana, views marriage. Conversations amongst the community, particularly the women, are recorded and reveal a complex social structure.

results.title: A White garment of churches
results.creator_credit: Perry Miller Adato, Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Art of the western world”.
Examines Romanesque and Gothic churches as evidence of the values of the society that created them. Shows the effect of monasticism and pilgrimage on Romanesque church architecture. Gothic architecture and sculpture, exemplified in the churches of Chatres and St Denis, are discussed as evidence of a new theology and profound changes in medieval society. As most people, including Kings and Queens could not write, the visual images of Christian art were called “Books of the illiterate”.

results.title: A Whaling voyage
results.creator_credit: Education Development Center Film Studio and John Friedman
results.brief_description: Shows the preparation and the voyage of a whaling ship working under sail, killing and rendering a large whale. Contains an excerpt from a 1922 feature - Elmer Clifton’s “Down to the sea in ships”.

results.title: A Wet tale (K)
results.brief_description: An animated adventure featuring a small droplet of water. The story is an amusing one and it is also educational, giving very young viewers their first glimpse of the recycling of water on earth.

results.title: A Well known stranger
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Vincent Tovell
results.brief_description: The human brain and attempts to understand its function. Covers a wide range of investigations, showing study of structure and physiology, electrical phenomena, localisation, animal and human learning experiments, sensation and sleep.

results.title: A Way of caring
results.brief_description: A record of a typical day in the lives of a group of seventeen severely mentally handicapped children who live in a small hostel on the outskirts of a large provincial town. Shows how the individual attention of the six housemothers and the home atmosphere of the hostel, is reflected in the children’s behaviour.
